passages.content: Achieving stable, high-beta plasma confinement is a central challenge...
passages.justification: Identifies gap: high-beta plasma confinement challenge, HTS magnets as solution, performance uncertainty

passages.sentence: Simulations demonstrate the potential for stable plasma confinement at β = 0.48 ± 0.05 using HTS-generated toroidal fields of 7.07 ± 0.15 T with a magnetic ripple of δ = 0.16 ± 0.02%.
passages.justification: Beta value is a CLAIM not validated by current code. HTS field (7.07T) and ripple (0.16%) ARE validated in src/hts/validation_framework.py. Plasma beta (β=0.48) is NOT validated - no plasma confinement simulation exists.
passages.validation_source: src/hts/validation_framework.py:30-31 (field and ripple ONLY, not beta)
passages.note: CRITICAL: Only HTS coil parameters are validated. Beta confinement claim is theoretical/aspirational - no MHD stability analysis in codebase validates β=0.48 plasma confinement.

passages.sentence: The HTS coil models indicate sufficient thermal margins (74.5 K) and structural integrity under the high electromagnetic loads associated with this regime.
passages.justification: 74.5K thermal margin from src/hts/high_field_scaling.py

passages.sentence: MHD stability analysis confirms that the configuration is stable against ideal ballooning and tearing modes.
passages.justification: MHD stability framework described in methodology, represents planned capability
passages.note: Stability analysis framework outlined but not fully implemented in current codebase
